author: DutchBlackOp
body:
There seems to be an issue with the -Name parameter for the Get-Package version. It does not work.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19817594/92110971-daaba180-edeb-11ea-96ac-725bfefc5e0e.png)

After I search for the packages from a specific provider the result seems to be somehow cached:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19817594/92111194-3e35cf00-edec-11ea-9ef3-17f69e3f3061.png)

Using the following Powershell version:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19817594/92111076-0af34000-edec-11ea-93e9-280255ec851c.png)

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @DutchBlackOp The cmdlet is not in the repository. Please open issue in PowerShellGet repository.

comments.author: DutchBlackOp
comments.body:
> @DutchBlackOp The cmdlet is not in the repository. Please open issue in PowerShellGet repository.

@iSazonov Thank you for the quick reply. My bad I have made a new issue in the correct repository.

title: Get-Package: issue with -Name parameter not working
